definition: according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before

sentences.english: But would you like express service or same-day?
sentences.chinese: 不外，您是要快洗效力照舊當日取？

sentences.english: Even though his sons tried, they couldn't straighten them out.
sentences.chinese: 不管他的兒子們怎麼用力，照舊不能把它們弄直。

sentences.english: MengFei resigned from the galactic work, but in the heart of the earth can't throw Chen son.
sentences.chinese: 孟菲辭去了銀河工作，但是陳超心裏照舊丟不下欣兒。

sentences.english: Reaching the number, he hurried up the steps and did not spare the bell in waking the servant.
sentences.chinese: 到了公寓，他急忙跨上臺階，照舊按鈴叫醒了女僕。

sentences.english: This is like chickens and eggs.
sentences.chinese: 這就像是倒底是先有雞照舊先有蛋的的原理。

sentences.english: There I am on top of the ten-story building again, chaussure louboutin, and I fall.
sentences.chinese: 我照舊在一座十層高的樓頂上，從上裏摔下來。

sentences.english: What color would you like, black or silver?
sentences.chinese: 您喜歡什麼顏色，玄色照舊銀色？

sentences.english: The monkey is stupid, or smart?
sentences.chinese: 山公是笨的，照舊智慧的？

sentences.english: With all his money and fame, he is not happy .
sentences.chinese: 有着錢和聲譽，他照舊煩懣樂。

sentences.english: You mys well tell me the truth.
sentences.chinese: 你照舊把事實告訴我爲好。

sentences.english: Will you come or shall I go at nine tomorrow morning?
sentences.chinese: 明天前晌九點鐘你來照舊我去呢？

sentences.english: When we were the Sick Man of Bsia, We were called The Yellow Peril.
sentences.chinese: 當咱們照舊亞洲弱國的時辰，咱們被叫做黃禍。

sentences.english: And all of a sudden, they want everything not to change.
sentences.chinese: 但突然之間，他們希望一切照舊，不要改變。

sentences.english: At first he opposed the marriage, but in the end he gave his consent.
sentences.chinese: 最後他反對這樁親事，但最終照舊贊同了。

sentences.english: “Business as usual will not do,” Dr Diouf declared.
sentences.chinese: 迪烏夫博士表示“一切照舊是不行的”。

sentences.english: Life continues until the next row erupts .
sentences.chinese: 一切生活照舊，直到爆發下一場爭吵。

definition: to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結賬|结账
to pay the bill (in a restaurant etc) (loanword from Cantonese)/(fig.) to bear responsibility
time/period during the day/one of the 12 two-hour periods enumerated by the earthly branches 地支
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
to agree (on a meeting place, date etc)/to reach agreement/to make an appointment
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
